org.teamfarce.mirch.map

Class Room

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.teamfarce.mirch.map.Room

  • public class Room
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines a room which is a game representation of a real world room in the Ron Cooke Hub.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Room.Transition
      This object stores data the links the rooms together

    • Field Detail

      • hidingSpots

        public java.util.List<Vector2Int> hidingSpots
        This list stores the coordinates of all hideable slots in this room Hideable slots are tiles that the clues can be hidden in

      • name

        private java.lang.String name
        This stores the name of the room. It is displayed on the tag when they enter the room

      • ID

        private int ID
        The integer ID of the room

      • mapFile

        private java.lang.String mapFile
        The string that points to the tmx map file for this room.

      • cluesInRoom

        private java.util.List<Clue> cluesInRoom
        This is a list of the clues in the room.

      • murderRoom

        private boolean murderRoom
        This stores whether or not the room is the room where the murder happened

      • map

        private com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMap map
        This stores the TMX map loaded from the String mapFile mapFile

      • lockedTiles

        private boolean[][] lockedTiles
        This stores the coordinates of the map in a 2x2 array. If a player/NPC attempts to move to a location, it locks the location before it moves, to avoid anything else moving to it.

      • roomTransitions

        private java.util.List<Room.Transition> roomTransitions
        Room transitions stored as custom Transition object. Defines where the transition is from and where it goes to

      • animationStateTime

        private float animationStateTime

        Parameters:

        batch - - The batch to draw the sprites to

      • lockCoordinate

        public void lockCoordinate(int x,
                           int y)
        This method locks the specified coordinates so no other people object can move to it
        Parameters:
        x - - The x coordinate to lock
        y - - The y coordinate to lock

        public void unlockCoordinate(int x,
                             int y)
        This method unlocks the specified coordinates so other people object can move to it
        Parameters:

        y - - The y coordinate to unlock

      • isWalkableTile

        public boolean isWalkableTile(Vector2Int v)
        This is the same method as below. Called using the Vector2Int as a parameter instead
        Parameters:
        v - - The position to check, represented as a Vector2Int
        Returns:
        Boolean - Whether the defined position is walkable or not

      • isWalkableTile

        public boolean isWalkableTile(int x,
                              int y)
        This method takes a current X and Y coordinate and checks through all the layers on the map to see if any tile IS NOT movable. If any tile IS NOT movable, it returns false.
        Parameters:
        x - - The x coordinate to check
        y - - The y coordinate to check
        Returns:
        - (boolean) whether or not that tile can be walked on.

      • isTriggerTile

        public boolean isTriggerTile(int x,
                             int y)
        This method checks ALL layers for the tile at x, y to see if it is a trigger tile. If any of them are true, it returns true
        Parameters:
        x - - The x coordinate to check
        y - - The y coordinate to check
        Returns:
        - (boolean) whether or not the tile is a trigger tile.

      • getMatRotation

        public java.lang.String getMatRotation(int x,
                                       int y)
        This method gets the rotation that the map is that they are standing on. If they aren't on a mat, it returns null
        Parameters:
        x - - The x coordinate to check
        y - = The y coordinate to check
        Returns:
        a String representing the direction they are facing

      • getTiledMap

        public com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMap getTiledMap()
        This returns the tiledMap for this room
        Returns:
        - (TiledMap) the map relating to this room.

        public Room addTransition(Room.Transition t)
        This adds a transition to the map.
        Parameters:
        t - - The transition to be added
        Returns:
        - (Room) itself

      • getHidingSpots

        public java.util.List<Vector2Int> getHidingSpots()
        This will check the map for any potential hiding locations, and returns them as a list of coordinates
        Returns:
        (List) list of coordinates of the hideable tiles

      • getRandHidingSpot

        public Vector2Int getRandHidingSpot()
        This gets a random possible location to hide a clue in
        Returns:
        (Vector2Int) Coordinates of the tile where the clue is to be hidden, null if there are none available

      • getTransitionData

        public Room.Transition getTransitionData(int x,
                                         int y)
        This method will get the transition data (if available) for the associated door mat in this room at the location x y.
        Parameters:
        x - - The current x coordinate in the room (in terms of tiles not pixels)
        y - - The current y coordinate in the room (in terms of tiles not pixels)
        Returns:
        - (Transition) a Transition data type. Which stores the relevant information. null if there is no transition at x, y

      • hasTransition

        private Room.Transition hasTransition(Vector2Int v)
        This method checks through all the transitions of this room and if one exists where the FROM property is equal to the parameter 'v' then it returns that Transition, else, it returns null
        Parameters:
        v - - The vector containing the FROM coordinates
        Returns:
        - (Transition) nullable Transition - the transition if it exists, else, null

      • getRandomLocation

        public Vector2Int getRandomLocation()
        This method returns a random location in the room that is walkable
        Returns:
        (Vector2Int) the random walkable tile generated.
